comment: Dr. B is a good professor.  He is understanding and will work with you if you attend his office hours.  He is invested in the success of his students.  I had him for both 3361 and 3362.  He is even wiling to help with lab if he isn't your lab professor.  Worth the time to take his class!

Just don't take organic at this school. He doesn't really prepare you for his test and the way he explains things is around the bush instead of STRAIGHT FORWARD. Be a transient and take this class at a junior college it will behoove you. Half of the class are repeating students. meaning students who have taken this course before
Not my teaching style, likes to just ask student all the questions; hard to learn that way in a class of 100+ people. Very confusing as to what is on the tests. Avoid him if possible.

Breezes through rhe material skips around the text tries to correspond his lab to lecture instead of teaching you concisely includes a lot of material that you do not need to know and tells you dont get too excited about this stuff try to avoid his class because he tries too hard for students to struggle instead making the material flow

Dr. B is one of the best professors to take for this subject. Organic chemistry is a hard subject no matter what, but he does his best to communicate the information so it is easy to understand. Do ALL the practice problems. Also extremely helpful in lab. Tests are not easy, but he does give partial credit. Go to class. No curves on exams either.

The worst professor I've EVER had in my entire life. His power points don't help. Your better off using other internet sources to teach you. His tests consists off practice problems that he doesn't show how to do in class. Seriously, the worst.

Dude is crazy! Never got an email response all year long. He will make a spectacle of you for asking questions. Random quizzes & HW, which he asks for broad info and tells you it isn't enough. Tests are  hard, 25-30 questions, leaving no room for error. Read the whole textbk if you want to REALLY learn! Purchase ACS study guide ASAP, his PPTs SUCK!

Took him for Chem 1211 in fall '13. He definitely not as bad as people on here say he is. I barely studied for exams and made a high B in the class. He gives quizzes that are very easy. If you're good at chemistry take him. If not... go with someone else.

He knows a lot about chem but he does not know how to get it across. He does not care if you pass or fail. I would recommend not taking him. Chemistry is hard and it doesn't help having a terrible teacher to make it even more difficult.

He knows a lot but he doesn't' know how to get it across so it makes sense. Teaches Gen Chem like its an upper level chemistry. Study guides not useful, quizzes and tests harder than he teaches. working outside of class can help some but the SI leader was better at teaching than the teacher. Puts you to sleep during lecture and gives surprise hw

I would not recommend him, the study guides are not helpful and the problems given on the exam are about 50 times more complicated that the ones shown in the text. The lecture notes are not clear and are unreliable to look back over. Moves very fast. Tests are very math based.

Not recommended. He makes a ton of mistakes! He relies most of his teaching on what is written on the slides of his presentations that were created long ago! Plus, they're filled with mistakes. I had to go multiple times on the Internet to see if I was learning the right thing..

He wants you to ask questions, but when you do, he makes you look like an idiot. I am a 4.0 student and I struggled to get a B in his class. He covers the material in class however, his tests are hard as hell and the questions are very complex. He always puts answer choices in that could trick you. There are not many grades for this class either.

AWFUL. I feel dumber having taken his class. I tutor my friends in their chem classes, and yet I was barely to make a B. His lectures are unintellectual. He spends too much time on the easy concepts, and avoids the hard ones as if he does not know them.. The tests are insane and mostly from the book. And for the love of God don't ask a question.
I had Dr. B for lab. He was extremely helpful sometimes teaching me better than my lecture professor. He is humorous and makes labs fun.
HE IS AWESOME! TAKE HIM! Don't listen to these other people. They don't want to work outside of class. It's Organic. You have to do more than just rely on the teacher.

If your not good at Chemistry Pls RUN from this guy.His test are hard and he dosen't care if you pass or fail. I used to go to his office for extra help but he got really mean and snaped at me that i had to stop going.Save yourself from the trauma and take someone else... Chem 1212 is hard enough, you don't need extra harshness from him.

The negative ratings Dr. Brixius recieved i am sure from the group of students that do not belong in Chem 1212. It is a very hard course in general and he does a good job as professor (-B). Read the book and go to class and you will be fine with this professor. He does make small mistakes with his math but he has a strong understanding of the facts

Teaches on the baseless assumption that you're already a documented expert at chemistry, so if you barely made it through Chem 1211, not suggested that you take Dr. Brixius. He seems to hate being asked questions, makes constant mathematical and algebraic mistakes on the board which makes his examples hard to follow when we have to stop every 2 minutes and correct him. His tests are very difficult relative the other Chem teachers', the class average remained around 50-60ish for each exam.

I think everyone that rated him before just hates people and wants to watch them fail! He is the WORST teacher ever! Over half the class dropped and I wish I did...the first test average was below a 50 the other two so far below a 60....he also tells at you if you ask questions in class and he says he wants you to come to his office but he doesn't...terrible terrible teacher...so whatever you do...DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!
TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN! He is a great professor and you WILL learn organic chemistry if you put the effort in. It's not easy but he is willing to help you. Best Science Prof I EVER had!

Dr. B is a FANTASTIC Chemistry professor. He is very intelligent when it comes to Organic Chemistry and he teaches with enthusiasm. During the whole semester, he answered every question he was ever asked in class, and also was available for questions before or after class. He has a great personality and makes learning organic chemistry fun. I found
He was a great teacher. I asked a lot of questions and he never made me feel bad. He helps you if you ask for it.

He is a horrible teacher. He expects you to already know the material he is teaching, and if you ask questions frequently, be careful! He will make you look like a moron for not understanding the material. He is not helpful at all. If you are not good at chemistry in the first place-- DO NOT TAKE HIM! I had to withdraw.

(1211): Although straight forward, he is difficult to understand. Does not convey his point visually, & when he actually decides to pick up a marker, the examples are sloppy and small. The test averages commonly plunge into the D's and sometimes lower. The quiz questions are often too complicated for information learned only in the previous class.

I've never rated a professor before but I felt the need to rate Dr. B. I took him this summer and was expecting to not do well since I made a "C" in 1151. I could not have been more wrong! His lectures are interesting and he cuts out all the B.S. His tests are semi-hard but use the provided study material and you should be fine! Highly Recomend!

Like the poster below me stated, he said he would curve...he tricked us into taking additional 2 tests in a month before classes ended! He's good at lecturing but he had horrible quizzes and tests. He tells you a certain thing will be on the quiz when it isn't. Basically google your 1st test, and most likely you'll find his other tests!

Very friendly prof., but I found that his teaching doesn't translate very well. It was not unusual to have a class average in the low 40's on exams. First class I failed in my entire college experience and I'm an A/B student. Said he would curve exams, but that does not appear to be the case. Avoid and take another prof for Organic.

Great guy.genuinely nice. Provides minor assignments to help your grade. The class is tough some say its a huge weed out class. The final is very comprehensive so study. Tests are difficult but Brixius does his best to prepare you. Have to put the time into this class for grade As are rare Bs pretty average.

I had him for a lab and I highly recommend him. He would answer any question you had and would walk around and if he saw you were doing something wrong or even had a wrong answer, he would correct you. He is just an all around nice guy and fun to talk to. TAKE HIM!
I had Dr. Brixius for lab. He is very easy going and will pretty much walk you through your lab. This lab is not extraordinary, neither is it terrible. All I can say is that he is helpful.

Great teacher. He really cares about the students, and he is very good about going back to explain things. All his notes are posted online, so you can print them out and make extra notes. His tests aren't exactly easy, but they aren't too difficult either, and he gives study guides, and tries to go over the study guide during class. Worth taking.
